bwwExcerpt: The language can suddenly switch from country bumpkin to a level of sophistication well beyond the credible, as when Harry, a Marxist, says one moment, “Nebody’s deing what we de”; at the next, “This is just the start. This place’ll be an academy. In years to come it’ll be teeming with artists in here.” And George proclaims, “They’re not ganna leave yer Shakespeare and Goethe just for the upper classes now -- it’s ganna belang to us.”
